frame.name: Visit_host_arrival
frame.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the <fen>Host_location</fen> to visit the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Normal_location
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Normal_location</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While <fen>Normal_location</fen> expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent. If present, they often express a general direction from which a <fen>Visitor</fen> moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Normal_location</fen> nor a <fen>Host_location</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a via-sense.</def-root>

FE.name: Host
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host</fen> welcomes the <fen>Visitor</fen> as a guest. The location strongly associated with the Host serves as the goal of the <fen>Visitor</fen>'s motion.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> expression describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives.</def-root>

FE.name: Mode_of_transportation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Visitor</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Visitor</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the <fen>Host</fen> or <fen>Host_location</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Host_location
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a location associated with the <fen>Host</fen>, and is commonly the place of residence or employment of the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where the arrival event occurs.</def-root>
